name: Financial Analyst / FP&A
description: Builds financial models, forecasts, and variance analyses. Supports strategic decision-making through data-driven financial insights. Ensures accuracy in reporting and supports budget planning and capital allocation decisions.
coreResponsibilities: Build and maintain financial models and forecasts
Conduct variance analysis and explain drivers
Support annual budgeting and quarterly re-forecasting
Prepare financial reports for leadership and board
Analyze capital investments and calculate ROI/IRR
Partner with business units on financial planning
successMetrics: Budget variance explanations accepted by leadership
painPoints: 85% of time on labor-intensive data prep, only 15% on actual analysis (Gartner)
Multiple data sources requiring manual reconciliation (ERP, CRM, accounting)
Data quality issues and inconsistencies across systems
Limited ability to create ad-hoc analyses due to time constraints
Explaining variances without complete visibility into business drivers
sources: Gartner FP&A Research - Time allocation studies
